title: Have a look at Mad Max: Fury Road as a retro 8-bit game - Gaming
text: Who would have thought that a retro-inspired game based on Mad Max: Fury Road would look so appealing?Although we might never get to play it, CineFix has come up with its own rendition of what an 8-bit adaptation of the 2015 action film could look like."CineFix presents Mad Max: Fury Road retold via old-school 8-bit (and a little 16 bit ;) game tech," reads the project's description. "No quarters or controllers required!"CineFix is known for making '80s arcade and NES-inspired 'gamified' versions of select Hollywood blockbusters, including Forrest Gump, Fast & Furious and Mean Girls.It also previously created a video that covered many of Anchorman's popular moments - including Baxter the dog saving Ron and Veronica against bears.Iron Man was even given a similar 8-bit game treatment.
